Dear Bill:
I noticed on page 59 of Broadcasting for December 18 a story about
a meeting between members of the NAB Freedom on Information Committee
being luncheon guests of President Kennedy at the White House on
December 12. Naturally, this being an NAB group, no one from
educational broadcasting was there. But I think this is something
we ought to work on. Maybe Leonard Marks, who seems to know his way
around in Democratic political circles, could arrange, either to
get us in on another event of that kind, or better yet, arrange a
special session between some folks in &AEB and President Kennedy.
This would be a tremendous prestige gesture for educational broadcasting.
Incidentally, I know very well the principal assistant to
Senator Humphrey, Bill Connell, a^d would be glad to ask him to
give some help on this if you should need some.
With best personal regards,
Yours sincerely,
Burton Paulu
Director of Radio and
Television Broadcasting
BP:kk
P.S. With me back on the board, you’re going to hear from me often.’
